title: Kiyoo Kanda
text:
was a Japanese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Kanda played for <a href="Osaka%20SC">Osaka SC</a> was founded by his alma mater high school graduates and many <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> players <a href="Shiro%20Azumi">Shiro Azumi</a>, <a href="Fukusaburo%20Harada">Fukusaburo Harada</a>, <a href="Usaburo%20Hidaka">Usaburo Hidaka</a>, <a href="Toshio%20Hirabayashi">Toshio Hirabayashi</a>, <a href="Setsu%20Sawagata">Setsu Sawagata</a>, <a href="Kikuzo%20Kisaka">Kikuzo Kisaka</a>, <a href="Yoshio%20Fujiwara">Yoshio Fujiwara</a>, <a href="Shumpei%20Inoue">Shumpei Inoue</a>, <a href="Yoshimatsu%20Oyama">Yoshimatsu Oyama</a>, <a href="Toshio%20Miyaji">Toshio Miyaji</a>, <a href="Uichiro%20Hatta">Uichiro Hatta</a>, <a href="Sakae%20Takahashi">Sakae Takahashi</a> and <a href="Kiyonosuke%20Marutani">Kiyonosuke Marutani</a> were playing in those days.
National team career.
In May 1923, Kanda was selected <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> for <a href="Football%20at%20the%201923%20Far%20Eastern%20Championship%20Games">1923 Far Eastern Championship Games</a> in <a href="Osaka">Osaka</a>. At this competition, on May 23, he debuted against <a href="Philippines%20national%20football%20team">Philippines</a>. This match is Japan team first match in <a href="International%20A%20Match">International A Match</a>. He also played at <a href="Football%20at%20the%201925%20Far%20Eastern%20Championship%20Games">1925 Far Eastern Championship Games</a> in <a href="Manila">Manila</a>. He played 4 games for Japan until 1925. But Japan lost in both matches.
Kanda died on May 9, 1970.
